protocols.name: UDP
protocols.description: A connectionless transport protocol that provides a simple, unreliable message-passing service. UDP is designed for applications that do not require the reliability mechanisms of TCP.

rfcs.title: User Datagram Protocol
rfcs.description: The original UDP specification defining the protocol's header format and basic operation.

rfcs.title: Internet Protocol, Version 6 (IPv6) Specification
rfcs.description: Defines IPv6, including how UDP operates over the new protocol.

rfcs.title: The Lightweight User Datagram Protocol (UDP-Lite)
rfcs.description: A variant of UDP that allows partial checksum coverage for error-tolerant applications.

rfcs.title: IPv6 and UDP Checksums for Tunneled Packets
rfcs.description: Addresses checksum requirements for UDP tunneling over IPv6.

rfcs.title: Applicability Statement for the Use of IPv6 UDP Datagrams with Zero Checksums
rfcs.description: Specifies when zero checksums may be used with IPv6 UDP.

rfcs.title: UDP Usage Guidelines
rfcs.description: Comprehensive guidelines for application designers using UDP.

rfcs.title: Packetization Layer Path MTU Discovery for Datagram Transports
rfcs.description: DPLPMTUD mechanism for discovering path MTU for UDP-based protocols.

rfcs.title: Discovering Provisioning Domain Names and Data
rfcs.description: Extends network configuration to include provisioning domains.

rfcs.title: Intarea Tunneling Protocol (ITP)
rfcs.description: Experimental tunneling protocol using UDP encapsulation.

rfcs.title: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)
rfcs.description: Updated TCP specification, relevant to UDP for comparison.

rfcs.title: Applicability of the QUIC Transport Protocol
rfcs.description: Discusses when QUIC (built on UDP) should be used.

rfcs.title: Manageability of the QUIC Transport Protocol
rfcs.description: Network management considerations for QUIC over UDP.

protocols.name: QUIC
protocols.description: A modern, encrypted, multiplexed transport protocol built on UDP. QUIC provides improved performance over TCP+TLS, with features like 0-RTT connection establishment and stream multiplexing.

rfcs.title: QUIC: A UDP-Based Multiplexed and Secure Transport
rfcs.description: The core QUIC transport protocol specification.

rfcs.title: Using TLS to Secure QUIC
rfcs.description: Describes the integration of TLS 1.3 with QUIC.

rfcs.title: QUIC Loss Detection and Congestion Control
rfcs.description: Specifies loss recovery and congestion control mechanisms.

rfcs.title: HTTP/3
rfcs.description: HTTP semantics over QUIC transport.

rfcs.title: QPACK: Field Compression for HTTP/3
rfcs.description: Header compression designed specifically for HTTP/3 over QUIC.

rfcs.title: Extensible Prioritization Scheme for HTTP
rfcs.description: Priority signaling for HTTP/2 and HTTP/3.

rfcs.title: An Unreliable Datagram Extension to QUIC
rfcs.description: Enables unreliable datagram transmission over QUIC connections.

rfcs.title: DNS over Dedicated QUIC Connections
rfcs.description: Specifies DNS over QUIC (DoQ) for encrypted DNS queries.

rfcs.title: Greasing the QUIC Bit
rfcs.description: Mechanism to exercise extension points in QUIC.

rfcs.title: Applicability of the QUIC Transport Protocol
rfcs.description: Guidance on when QUIC is appropriate.

rfcs.title: Manageability of the QUIC Transport Protocol
rfcs.description: Network management considerations for QUIC.

rfcs.title: QUIC Version 2
rfcs.description: Updates to QUIC with improved security properties.
